oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Radio Tribute Broadcast - Bud Isaacs - yyyy-mm-dd
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: NPR broadcast of radio special on steel guitarist Bud Isaacs aired on KJZZ in Mesa Arizona for the Arizona Week Special produced by Mark Moran. Unidentified date but likely circa 1998.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bud Isaacs; Mike Moran;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Includes segments with Bud Isaacs, Geri Isaacs, Tommy Hill and Bob Hardy / (00:00) Radio program introduction / (00:22) Historical background on Isaacs' career / (00:57) Isaacs demonstrates pedal steel guitar / (02:18) Working with the Sons of The Pioneers and Roy Rogers / (02:47) Working with Hank Williams / (04:06) Packing up and leaving Nashville for Arizona / (04:23) Current times and the hardships of traveling / (05:24) Hearing the steel guitar for the first time and first travels to Nashville / (05:55) Tommy Hill comments on Isaacs playing / (06:22) Isaacs comments on how he feels about other people copying his style / (06:46) Isaacs with his feelings about current country music / (07:07) Isaacs today / (07:32) Program sign off with music / (07:56) TAPE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Isaacs, Bud, 1923-2016; Moran, Mark; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
